total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the positions of the number 3 in the input grid.
Q2: Count the number of 3s in each row and column.
Q3: Identify the positions of the number 2 in the input grid.
Q4: Count the number of 2s in each row and column.
Q5: Compare the counts of 3s and 2s in each row and column.
Q6: Create a new grid with the same number of rows and 3 columns.
Q7: Fill the new grid with 1s in the positions where the count of 3s is greater than the count of 2s, and with 0s elsewhere.
Q1: Identify the positions of the number 3 in the input grid.
Q2: Count the number of 3s in each row and column.
Q3: Identify the positions of the number 2 in the input grid.
Q4: Count the number of 2s in each row and column.
Q5: Compare the counts of 3s and 2s in each row and column.
Q6: Create a new 3x3 grid.
Q7: If a row or column has more 3s than 2s, mark the corresponding cell in the new grid as 1.
Q8: If a row or column has more 2s than 3s, mark the corresponding cell in the new grid as 0.
Q9: If a row or column has an equal number of 3s and 2s, leave the corresponding cell in the new grid as 0.

Q9: If a row or column has an equal number of 2s and 3s, leave the corresponding cell in the new grid as 0.
